title: Star Wars: The Clone Wars (2008 TV series)
summary: Star Wars: The Clone Wars is a computer-animated television series created by George Lucas.[1] The series began with a theatrical feature film that was released on August 15, 2008, and debuted on Cartoon Network two months later on October 3, 2008.[2] It is set in the fictional Star Wars galaxy during the three years between the prequel films Episode II: Attack of the Clones and Episode III: Revenge of the Sith. Being a reboot of the previous 2D series Star Wars: Clone Wars (2003–2005), each episode had a running time of approximately 22 minutes to fill a half-hour time slot instead of the 3–15 minute episodes that the previous series had. Dave Filoni was the supervising director of the series.[3]
